ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Attack speedups
ygData.msgSnippet: heh, If I had been planning for it I would have had CoD loaded as well :) It is something that just happened. The wiz called for the group to zone, but I said
ygData.messageBody:
heh, If I had been planning for it I would have had CoD loaded as well :) It
is something that just happened. The wiz called for the group to zone, but I
said no and shouted for the healing support. I was the highest level in the
group, the rest were 42-45. Yes it was nerve-wracking, but it sure was a
rush :) Speaking of nerve-wracking I heard a group on our server broke
Efreeti with 4 people recently, sound like something I would like to try one
day.

Rokenn

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 30, 2000 11:16 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Attack speedups


On Thu, 30 Mar 2000, Reeves, Patrick W wrote:

> Really? The other night in at nox area in Sol B we had a bad pull coupled
> with a respawn and ended up with 5 sonic bats. I shouted for the cleric
and
> druid to keep me healed and went with Niv's + Hymn + CoC. It was as long
> fight but we won. Every single person in the group was amazed that we did
> not have to zone and lost no members. Never underestimate your power as a
> Bard ;)

I wouldn't go about making this tactic common practice, unless
you're also grouped with an enchanter (AE stun) and
wizard/mage (AE nuke/rain). Yes you can do it with just
healers, but boy is it nervewracking (may be easier with bugs
and bats, but frogs tended to attack the healers after a bit).

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
